thread.title: Liverpool star Adam Lallana named England Player of the Year for 2016
thread.title_full: Liverpool star Adam Lallana named England Player of the Year for 2016

author: Jack Rathborn
title: Liverpool star Adam Lallana named England Player of the Year for 2016
text:
Sport Liverpool star Adam Lallana named England Player of the Year for 2016 The Reds midfielder shone for the Three Lions to add guile and creativity despite failure at Euro 2016 Share Adam Lallana celebrates scoring the first goal with team mates (Photo: Action Images via Reuters) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Liverpool star Adam Lallana has been named England Player of the Year for 2016. 
The 28-year-old broke through to become a key man under both Roy Hodgson and Sam Allardyce. 
A stoppage time winner in the World Cup 2018 qualifier against Slovakia was a personal highlight for the former Southampton talent. Read More Sam Allardyce wanted to speak to John Terry about England recall but move was 'vetoed by the FA' 
Lallana scored three goals in 10 appearances over the calendar year to shine despite the Three Lions' poor showing at Euro 2016. 
Lallana did not feature in the dismal Last 16 loss to Iceland with Hodgson preferring a front four of Wayne Rooney, Daniel Sturridge, Harry Kane and Raheem Sterling. poll loading Will Adam Lallana score 10 or more Premier League goals this season? 500+ VOTES SO FAR
